channel.title: Need Help On Password Encryption!
channel.description:
character-username = potent character-password = 233-158-22-195-43-203-56-213-242-96-133-54-120-146-46-3
--------------------------------------------------------------------
I've been trying to fix this forever... I need to fix it because if you change your password it becomes invalid. And I can't mess around and hack noobs cheating on the game... If anyone can help it'd totally 100% be appreciated. I haven't seen a guide to fix this in ages since only old servers did this. I don't need this i don't share hosting the server I host and edit the server. So if someone can help thanks a BUNCH! :)

item.title: Need Help On Password Encryption!
item.dc:creator: @Noob_Slayerz Noob Slayerz
item.description:
@Noob_Slayerz wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:12, topic:157422”][quote author=Potent link=topic=214645.msg1872510#msg1872510 date=1194403062]
If you didn’t help I’d probably remake my whole entire source =S And the big problem is I haven’t edited Java in forever lmao.
[/quote]
No you wouldn’t. You’d copy and paste more stuff.[/quote]

Ownt lol. How do you want to “fix” this. There was nothing wrong with this, you just want to steal peoples accounts and passwords for runescape…

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help On Password Encryption!
item.dc:creator: @Potent Potent
item.description:
@Potent wrote:

WOW ROFL. I feel like an idiot. All I had to search was Encryption?[br][size=1]Posted on: November 06, 2007, 03:22:45 PM[/size][hr]client.java:8715: cannot find symbol
symbol : method md5(java.lang.String)
location: class client
String hashPW = md5(playerPass);
^
client.java:9902: cannot find symbol
symbol : method md5(java.lang.String)
location: class client
String hashPW = md5(playerPass);
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
